title: Why are a lot of children songs just the same melody with different lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: The real reason is that a lot of children’s songs are old nursery rhymes(many of which were written by adults for adults, and have nothing to do with nurseries or even children), which were sung to whatever common melody seemed to fit. It’s worth noting that just as a lot of different rhymes are often sung to the same melody, the same rhyme can often be sung to a variety of different melodies.
Because children do not have a huge capacity for memorizing a repertoire of songs. Ba ba black sheep and twinkle twinkle little star being an obvious example.
